pull.title: doc: Adjust commit message template for the guix.sigs repo
pull.body: Seems to be the most common template used, so adjust this here, too.

events.body:
ACK fa3b92d20570c72a3178c693afb81e105849805f.

Curly braces could be skipped for clarity.
I like to always add them for clarity

events.message: doc: Adjust commit message template for the guix.sigs repo

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -136,7 +136,7 @@ Commit your signature to guix.sigs:
 ```sh
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
-git commit -m "Add ${VERSION} unsigned sigs for ${SIGNER}"
+git commit -m "Add ${SIGNER} Guix attestations for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: Don't think this needs to mention "Guix", it's the guix signatures repository so that is implicit.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -136,7 +136,7 @@ Commit your signature to guix.sigs:
 ```sh
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
-git commit -m "Add ${VERSION} unsigned sigs for ${SIGNER}"
+git commit -m "Add ${SIGNER} Guix attestations for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body:
I am also thinking if the sentence was proper English before.

Shouldn't it say "Add attestations *by* $SIGNER for $VERSION non-codesigned"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -136,7 +136,7 @@ Commit your signature to guix.sigs:
 ```sh
 pushd ./guix.sigs
 git add "${VERSION}/${SIGNER}"/noncodesigned.SHA256SUMS{,.asc}
-git commit -m "Add ${VERSION} unsigned sigs for ${SIGNER}"
+git commit -m "Add ${SIGNER} Guix attestations for ${VERSION} non-codesigned"
comments.body: Yes, that'd be even better I think.
